item.title:
Sea otters pet their cheeks because they have glands that secrete oils there. They gather that oil on their paws and then brush it along the rest of their fur to keep it soft, sleek, cleans and waterproof

item.title:
Place your eggs in a glass of water. If it sinks to the bottom, it's fresh. If it stands on one end close to the bottom, it's a few weeks old, still fine to eat. If it floats to the surface, it's no longer fresh.
[read more: https://t.co/VVpB7n5VY3] https://t.co/sC4odJUaMw

item.title: Because I like to try new things, I built it on top of the decentralized polygon network. All posts are emitted on chain using a custom smart contract. It costs around 1c to post. I coded the entire stack from scratch.
item.description: Because I like to try new things, I built it on top of the decentralized polygon network. All posts are emitted on chain using a custom smart contract. It costs around 1c to post. I coded the entire stack from scratch.
item.content:encoded: Because I like to try new things, I built it on top of the decentralized polygon network. All posts are emitted on chain using a custom smart contract. It costs around 1c to post. I coded the entire stack from scratch.

item.title: As I improve the platform, I will post more personal things over there. I might explain how it all works too, if there is interest. It is an interesting code stack that involves, solidity, node.js, polygon, firebase, ipfs, moralis‚Ä¶

item.title:
Isaac Newton regarded all varying quantities as flowing quantities. He called fluxion the rate of flowing - he used the dotted notation to refer to it.
Adopting his fluxional notation we can write mechanical equations considering x as a flowing quantity! https://t.co/Ol7MCjiOI2

item.title:
When developing CoDoC, we had 3 criteria:
‚ö™ Non-AI experts including clinicians could use the system on a single computer ‚ö™ Training would require a relatively small amount of data ‚ö™ CoDoC could be compatible with many proprietary AI models

item.title:
üîµ How was CoDoC trained?
It needs 3 anonymised inputs for each case in the dataset:
üîò A confidence score from the predictive AI üîò The clinician‚Äôs opinion on the medical image üîò The ground truth of whether disease was present, established via clinical follow-up https://t.co/7ec0dbdyaE

item.content:encoded: üîµ How was CoDoC trained? It needs 3 anonymised inputs for each case in the dataset: üîò A confidence score from the predictive AI üîò The clinician‚Äôs opinion on the medical image üîò The ground truth of whether disease was present, established via clinical follow-up https://t.co/7ec0dbdyaE

item.title:
üîµ What were the results?
In hypothetical simulations where an AI could act autonomously at certain points, CoDoC reduced the number of clinician reads required by 66%.
We also showed how it can help examine chest X-rays to decide if a TB test is needed. https://t.co/gZtLxBVRSr https://t.co/FJmmKkEvLP

item.content:encoded: üîµ What were the results? In hypothetical simulations where an AI could act autonomously at certain points, CoDoC reduced the number of clinician reads required by 66%. item.title:
üîµ What's next?
Our theoretical research explores how to harness this type of human-AI collaboration in safety-critical applications.
We are open sourcing CoDoC's code so others can build on our work improving the safety of AI models for the real world: https://t.co/Wr0tSSJGmm
